verses.esv: 28 And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.
verses.kjv: 28 And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
verses.niv: 28 And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.

verses.esv: 4 He will wipe away every tear from their eyes, and death shall be no more, neither shall there be mourning, nor crying, nor pain anymore, for the former things have passed away.”
verses.kjv: 4 And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.
verses.niv: 4 He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away."

verses.esv: 2 Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds, 3 for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness. 4 And let steadfastness have its full effect, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.
verses.kjv: 2 My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations; 3 Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience. 4 But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
verses.niv: 2 Consider it pure joy, my brothers, whenever you face trials of many kinds, 3 because you know that the testing of your faith develops perseverance. 4 Perseverance must finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.

verses.esv: 7 So to keep me from becoming conceited because of the surpassing greatness of the revelations, a thorn was given me in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to harass me, to keep me from becoming conceited. 8 Three times I pleaded with the Lord about this, that it should leave me. 9 But he said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore I will boast all the more gladly of my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may rest upon me. 10 For the sake of Christ, then, I am content with weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and calamities. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
verses.kjv: 7 And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure. 8 For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me. 9 And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me. 10 Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.
verses.niv: 7 To keep me from becoming conceited because of these surpassingly great revelations, there was given me a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me. 8 Three times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me. 9 But he said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness." Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may rest on me. 10 That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.

verses.esv: 2 Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds,
verses.kjv: 2 My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;
verses.niv: 2 Consider it pure joy, my brothers, whenever you face trials of many kinds,

verses.esv:
42:1 Then Job answered the LORD and said:

2   “I know that you can do all things,
    and that no purpose of yours can be thwarted.
3   ‘Who is this that hides counsel without knowledge?’
  Therefore I have uttered what I did not understand,
    things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.
4   ‘Hear, and I will speak;
    I will question you, and you make it known to me.’
5   I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear,
    but now my eye sees you;
6   therefore I despise myself,
    and repent in dust and ashes.”
verses.kjv: 1 Then Job answered the LORD, and said, 2 I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee. 3 Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not. 4 Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me. 5 I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee. 6 Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.
verses.niv: 1 Then Job replied to the LORD: 2 "I know that you can do all things; no plan of yours can be thwarted. 3 You asked, 'Who is this that obscures my counsel without knowledge?' Surely I spoke of things I did not understand, things too wonderful for me to know. 4 "You said, 'Listen now, and I will speak; I will question you, and you shall answer me.' 5 My ears had heard of you but now my eyes have seen you. 6 Therefore I despise myself and repent in dust and ashes."

verses.esv:
27   So God created man in his own image,
    in the image of God he created him;
    male and female he created them.
verses.kjv: 27 So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
verses.niv: 27 So God created man in his own image, in the image of God he created him; male and female he created them.

verses.esv: 6 In this you rejoice, though now for a little while, if necessary, you have been grieved by various trials, 7 so that the tested genuineness of your faith—more precious than gold that perishes though it is tested by fire—may be found to result in praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.kjv: 6 Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations: 7 That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:
verses.niv: 6 In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while you may have had to suffer grief in all kinds of trials. 7 These have come so that your faith--of greater worth than gold, which perishes even though refined by fire--may be proved genuine and may result in praise, glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.

verses.esv: 6 And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
verses.kjv: 6 But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
verses.niv: 6 And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.

verses.esv: 8 Although he was a son, he learned obedience through what he suffered.
verses.kjv: 8 Though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;
verses.niv: 8 Although he was a son, he learned obedience from what he suffered

verses.esv: 7 After the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite: “My anger burns against you and against your two friends, for you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.
verses.kjv: 7 And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
verses.niv: 7 After the LORD had said these things to Job, he said to Eliphaz the Temanite, "I am angry with you and your two friends, because you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.

verses.esv: 19 We know that we are from God, and the whole world lies in the power of the evil one.
verses.kjv: 19 And we know that we are of God, and the whole world lieth in wickedness.
verses.niv: 19 We know that we are children of God, and that the whole world is under the control of the evil one.

verses.esv:
15   Though he slay me, I will hope in him;
    yet I will argue my ways to his face.
verses.kjv: 15 Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
verses.niv: 15 Though he slay me, yet will I hope in him; I will surely defend my ways to his face.

verses.esv: 7 so that the tested genuineness of your faith—more precious than gold that perishes though it is tested by fire—may be found to result in praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.kjv: 7 That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:
verses.niv: 7 These have come so that your faith--of greater worth than gold, which perishes even though refined by fire--may be proved genuine and may result in praise, glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.

verses.esv: 6 In this you rejoice, though now for a little while, if necessary, you have been grieved by various trials,
verses.kjv: 6 Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:
verses.niv: 6 In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while you may have had to suffer grief in all kinds of trials.

verses.esv: 18 For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worth comparing with the glory that is to be revealed to us.
verses.kjv: 18 For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.
verses.niv: 18 I consider that our present sufferings are not worth comparing with the glory that will be revealed in us.

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv: 29 For it has been granted to you that for the sake of Christ you should not only believe in him but also suffer for his sake,
verses.kjv: 29 For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;
verses.niv: 29 For it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for him,

verses.esv: 19 Now the works of the flesh are evident: sexual immorality, impurity, sensuality, 20 idolatry, sorcery, enmity, strife, jealousy, fits of anger, rivalries, dissensions, divisions, 21 envy, drunkenness, orgies, and things like these. I warn you, as I warned you before, that those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.kjv: 19 Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are these; Adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness, 20 Idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies, 21 Envyings, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told you in time past, that they which do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.niv: 19 The acts of the sinful nature are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity and debauchery; 20 idolatry and witchcraft; hatred, discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish ambition, dissensions, factions 21 and envy; drunkenness, orgies, and the like. I warn you, as I did before, that those who live like this will not inherit the kingdom of God.

verses.esv: 11:1 Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
verses.kjv: 1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
verses.niv: 1 Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see.

verses.esv: 6 And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ.
verses.kjv: 6 Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
verses.niv: 6 being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.

verses.esv:
11   For he will command his angels concerning you
    to guard you in all your ways.
verses.kjv: 11 For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
verses.niv: 11 For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways;

verses.esv:
7   He stretches out the north over the void
    and hangs the earth on nothing.
verses.kjv: 7 He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
verses.niv: 7 He spreads out the northern skies over empty space; he suspends the earth over nothing.

verses.esv:
3   Shall windy words have an end?
    Or what provokes you that you answer?
verses.kjv: 3 Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
verses.niv: 3 Will your long-winded speeches never end? What ails you that you keep on arguing?

verses.esv: 9 I, John, your brother and partner in the tribulation and the kingdom and the patient endurance that are in Jesus, was on the island called Patmos on account of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.
verses.kjv: 9 I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.
verses.niv: 9 I, John, your brother and companion in the suffering and kingdom and patient endurance that are ours in Jesus, was on the island of Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.
